title: Hearty Chili
description: Warm, spicy beef and bean chili for colder days.
ingredients: 1 can (400 g) kidney beans, drained and rinsed
steps: Heat olive oil in a pot and sauté onion until translucent.
Add garlic and ground beef, cook until browned and crumbled.
Stir in tomato paste, chili powder and cumin, cook 1–2 minutes.
Add chopped tomatoes and kidney beans, stir well.
Simmer on low heat for 20–30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Season with salt and pepper and adjust chili to taste.

title: Overnight Oats with Berries
description: Creamy oats soaked overnight with yogurt, chia and mixed berries.
ingredients: 200 ml unsweetened almond milk (or milk of choice)
Cinnamon or vanilla extract to taste
steps: Add oats, chia seeds and a pinch of salt to a jar or container.
Pour in almond milk and stir in yogurt, maple syrup, and cinnamon or vanilla.
Mix well, then fold in the berries.
Cover and refrigerate overnight (or at least 4 hours).
Stir before serving. Add a splash of milk if it is too thick.

title: Lentil & Vegetable Soup
description: Simple one-pot lentil soup loaded with vegetables.
ingredients: 200 g dry red or green lentils, rinsed
steps: Heat olive oil in a large pot and sauté onion, carrot and celery until softened.
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Add lentils, vegetable broth, bay leaf and thyme.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer 25–30 minutes until lentils are tender.
Remove bay leaf, season with salt, pepper and lemon juice.
Serve as is or partially blend for a creamier texture.

title: Greek Yogurt Parfait
description: Layered yogurt, fruit and crunch for a quick breakfast or snack.
ingredients: 20 g nuts or seeds, roughly chopped
steps: Add a layer of yogurt to a glass or bowl.
Add a layer of berries or fruit.
Sprinkle with nuts, seeds and granola if using.
Repeat layers if you want it taller.
Drizzle with honey or maple syrup if desired.

title: Tofu Veggie Stir-Fry
description: Quick pan-fried tofu with colourful vegetables in a simple soy-garlic sauce.
ingredients: 200 g firm tofu, pressed and cubed
1 small broccoli head (approx. 250 g), cut into florets
1 tsp cornstarch mixed with 2 tbsp water (optional, to thicken)
Sesame seeds and spring onions for garnish (optional)
steps: Press tofu to remove excess moisture, then cut into cubes.
Heat frying oil in a pan and fry tofu until golden on most sides, then set aside.
In the same pan, add sesame oil, garlic and ginger, sauté briefly.
Add broccoli, carrot and bell pepper, stir-fry 3–5 minutes until crisp-tender.
Return tofu to the pan and pour in soy sauce and cornstarch slurry if using.
Cook 1–2 minutes until the sauce lightly thickens.
Garnish with sesame seeds and spring onions if desired.

title: Zucchini Noodle Bolognese
description: Low-carb bolognese served over zucchini noodles instead of pasta.
ingredients: 350 g lean ground beef or turkey
2 medium zucchinis (approx. 400 g), spiralised into noodles
Grated Parmesan or hard cheese (optional, to serve)
steps: Heat olive oil in a pan and sauté onion until translucent.
Add garlic and ground meat, cook until browned.
Stir in chopped tomatoes, oregano and basil.
Simmer on low heat for 15–20 minutes, season with salt and pepper.
Lightly sauté zucchini noodles in a separate pan for 1–2 minutes or leave raw for extra crunch.
Serve bolognese sauce over zucchini noodles and top with cheese if using.

title: Simple Chickpea Salad
description: No-cook salad with chickpeas, crunchy vegetables and lemon dressing.
ingredients: 1 can (400 g) chickpeas, drained and rinsed
steps: Add chickpeas, cucumber, tomatoes and red onion to a bowl.
Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice.
Season with salt and pepper.
Toss everything together and top with chopped herbs.
Let sit for 10–15 minutes if possible so flavours develop.

title: Baked Salmon with Roasted Vegetables
description: Tray-bake salmon with mixed vegetables for an easy one-pan dinner.
ingredients: 150 g green beans or broccoli florets
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C (fan).
Toss potatoes, carrots and green beans/broccoli with 1.5 tbsp olive oil, paprika, thyme, salt and pepper.
Spread vegetables on a baking tray and roast for 15 minutes.
Push vegetables slightly aside and place salmon fillets in the middle, brushing them with remaining olive oil and seasoning with salt and pepper.
Bake another 10–12 minutes until salmon is cooked and vegetables are tender.
Serve with lemon wedges.

title: Protein Banana Pancakes
description: Fluffy banana pancakes made with eggs and oats, great for breakfast.
ingredients: 40 g oat flour or finely ground oats
Cinnamon and vanilla extract to taste
A little butter or oil for the pan
steps: Mash bananas in a bowl until mostly smooth.
Whisk in eggs, then add oat flour, baking powder, salt, cinnamon and vanilla.
Let the batter rest for 5 minutes.
Heat a non-stick pan with a little butter or oil on medium heat.
Pour small pancakes and cook until bubbles form, then flip and cook the other side.
Serve with berries, yogurt or a little syrup if desired.

title: Dark Chocolate Bark with Nuts & Fruit
description: Easy dessert or snack: melted dark chocolate topped with nuts and dried fruit.
ingredients: 200 g dark chocolate (70% or higher), chopped
20 g dried fruit (e.g. cranberries, raisins, chopped apricots)
steps: Melt the dark chocolate gently over a water bath or in the microwave at low power.
Line a baking tray with parchment paper.
Pour melted chocolate onto the paper and spread into an even layer.
Sprinkle nuts, dried fruit and flaky salt on top.
Let set at room temperature or in the fridge until firm.
Break into pieces and store in an airtight container.
